intro: Ficinia crinita, commonly known as the hairy fig tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, clustered flowers. It produces edible figs that are typically consumed fresh or used in local cuisines. Ficinia crinita is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
